all_questions.question: What was the initial strategy for organizing sentences during training?
all_questions.context: What we did was to organize the sentences into batches.

all_questions.question: How long were the shorter sentence batches?
all_questions.context: first we had this batch of very short sentences up to five words and the model learned somewhat.

all_questions.question: What was the effect of allowing longer sentence lengths during training?
all_questions.context: And then we opened, we exposed the model also to the longer sentences, so we allowed sentences of length up to ten.

all_questions.question: What was a consequence of allowing sentences of all lengths during training?
all_questions.context: And then in the end we allowed sentences of all lengths. So at this end of the training, which by the way indeed improved the baseline a little bit.

all_questions.question: What was Tom Cosme's idea for improving sentence diversity?
all_questions.context: Tom Cosme had this French idea to just flip the order of this sorted batched corpus.

selected_questions.question: What was Tom Cosme's idea for improving sentence diversity?
selected_questions.context: Tom Cosme had this French idea to just flip the order of this sorted batched corpus.

selected_questions.question: How long were the shorter sentence batches?
selected_questions.context: first we had this batch of very short sentences up to five words and the model learned somewhat.

selected_questions.question: What was the effect of allowing longer sentence lengths during training?
selected_questions.context: And then we opened, we exposed the model also to the longer sentences, so we allowed sentences of length up to ten.
